description: Haunted by stories of BCI abuse and driven by a quiet conversation with victims, Oksana Lintz discreetly distributes technical instructions and untraceable code to activist networks. She enables neighborhoods to erase and scramble their BCI scores, bypassing Directorate detection.

Neighborhoods across Stenograd begin mass disruptions of BCI scores. The 'Erase My Score' movement explodes, with citizens openly erasing or altering their records. Confusion at service points, workplaces, and checkpoints rapidly escalates.
Directorate launches crackdowns to restore BCI order. Armed interventions trigger clashes with citizens protecting erased scores, resulting in rolling network failures and wide distrust of authority.

In response to growing chaos, Innovator Council members introduce an 'open score' platform: anyone can view and amend BCI scores. The experiment leads to rampant manipulation, erasing any remaining trust in official rankings.
Job assignments, housing, and social services break down as BCI scores lose meaning. Residents and authorities both struggle for control, plunging Stenograd into uncertainty about what will follow.
